result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**904 entered in error**
Arraignment on November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF106, 22CF198 called at 8:35am 
Defendant William Alan Kaplan in court, in custody.  Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court for William Alan Kaplan.  Attorney Michael C. Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing occurs in Both 22CF106 & 22CF198:
Mr. Kaplan waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

On Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification: 
--no objection from ADA Witt; based on assertions in motion
--the Court grants motion

The Court requires a $2500 signature bond in each case, with special conditions, if any, to continue. 
recess: 8:41am  

NEXT:   Arraignment on 11/18/22 at 9:30am (Mr. Kaplan may appear remotely if in custody)
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail
FINANCIAL NOTES: Payment Plan Application received via mail.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ae] cases 22CF198 and 22CF106 2:04 PM Defendant William Alan Kaplan appeared by video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney De La Rosa [Defendant is SPD eligible]. ADA Beck in court for State of Wisconsin.
Parties discuss case history and missed appearances 
Bond arguments given 

As to 22CF198: The Court requires $200 CASH Bond , with same conditions previously ordered:
--not to operate a motor vehicle without valid drivers license

As to 22CF106 The Court requires $200 CASH Bond , with same conditions previously ordered:
--not to operate a motor vehicle without valid drivers license

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing 10/14/22 at 8:30 am

recess: 2:13 pm
Extradition Forecast
Returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate

[MK] cases #22CF106 and #22CF198 called at 9:14am 
Defendant William Alan Kaplan does not appear. Attorney Amber Rumpf appears. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
These cases are scheduled for Preliminary Hearings today, and the State's officer-witnesses are present. 
The Court orders issuance of a Bench Warrant in Case #22CF106, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.  The Warrant in Case #22CF198 continues to be active. 
recess 9:15am
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF106 & 22CF198 called at 9:45am 
Defendant William Alan Kaplan appears via zoom. Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears in court.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Kaplan updates address to: 24 Wilson Ave in Fort Atkinson.

Initial Apperance occurs in Case 22CF198: 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $150 CASH Bond, with condition: 
--not to operate a motor vehicle without valid drivers license 

The Court directs Mr. Kaplan to sign and post or cause to be posted the cash bond by 7/15/22 at 4:00pm 

recess: 9:58am 

NEXT:  As to BOTH Cases, Preliminary Hearing on 8/30/22at 9:00am

[ae] case called 11:23 AM Defendant William Alan Kaplan appeared by telephone in custody from the Jefferson County Jail. DA Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $2500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license 
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 11:35 am
